abstract: A tsunami in the Indian Ocean after the earthquake on Wednesday would have put the world's most isolated community of people at serious risk. Should the reclusive islanders on North Sentinel continue to be left alone, living largely as they have for the past 60,000 years? Or would they benefit more from ice, penicillin, Shakespeare and "civilization"?

headline.main: An Island's Other Fear --- a Tsunami of Civilization
